alert.note: Alert for Bollinger; Cape Girardeau; Carter; Perry; Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 3:16AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Patchy Dense Fog Possible Early This Morning... At 3 AM CDT...Satellite and reporting observations showed fog developing nearby and beginning to move into parts of southeast Missouri and southern Illinois as skies clear there. The fog may become dense in patches as the clearing skies allow temperatures to cool through the upper 60s. The best chance of this occurring will be in the Ozark highlands of southeast Missouri, especially along and northwest of a line from Perryville, to Greenville, to Van Buren. The fog may be dense in patches during the pre dawn hours but should lift and burn off everywhere by mid morning. If traveling early this morning, plan accordingly. Drive slowly and with caution, allowing yourself more time to brake, in case you encounter reduced visibility. Use your low beam headlights in fog.

area.areaDesc: Bollinger; Cape Girardeau; Carter; Perry; Wayne
